vague_description: Determine the optimal mix of helicopter and car trips to transport fish efficiently while adhering to certain constraints.
detailed_description: The weather is freezing and the fish in the pond need to be transported either by helicopter or car. A helicopter can take \param{FishPerHelicopter} fish per trip and takes \param{TimeHelicopter} minutes. A car can take \param{FishPerCar} fish per trip and takes \param{TimeCar} minutes. Since helicopter trips are expensive, there can be at most \param{MaxHelicopterTrips} helicopter trips. In addition, at least \param{CarTripPercentage} of the trips should be by car. If at least \param{MinFishNeeded} fish need to be transported, how many of each trip should be taken to minimize the total time needed?
target_objective: Minimize the total time needed to transport all the fish
target_constraints: Number of helicopter trips is non-negative
Number of car trips is non-negative
At least MinFishNeeded fish must be transported
There can be at most MaxHelicopterTrips helicopter trips
At least CarTripPercentage percent of the total number of trips must be by car
target_parameters: Number of fish transported per helicopter trip
Number of fish transported per car trip
Maximum number of helicopter trips allowed
Percentage of trips that should be by car
Minimum number of fish that need to be transported
